meanings.definition: Swollen or distended, as from a fluid; bloated.
meanings.sent1: The balloon looked turgid after being filled with air.
meanings.sent2: Her cheeks appeared turgid after eating too much salty food.
meanings.sent3: The frog's turgid belly made it waddle comically.
meanings.sent4: The river, turgid with rainwater, overflowed its banks.
meanings.sent5: The turgid clouds signaled an impending storm.

meanings.definition: Excessively ornate or complex in style; grandiloquent.
meanings.sent1: The turgid speech was hard to follow with all its fancy words.
meanings.sent2: The novel's turgid prose made it difficult to read.
meanings.sent3: The turgid description of the tiny ant seemed exaggerated.
meanings.sent4: Her turgid writing style drowned the reader in unnecessary details.
meanings.sent5: The turgid decorations overwhelmed the simple room.

meanings.definition: Overblown or pompous in language; bombastic.
meanings.sent1: His turgid boasting about his accomplishments annoyed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The politician's turgid promises failed to convince the voters.
meanings.sent3: The turgid speech about the importance of socks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her turgid claims of being the best singer fell flat.
meanings.sent5: The turgid advertisement made unrealistic claims about the product.
